scenario_text.value: Hey, Takuma, you won’t believe this!
Huh? What is it?

So, we were getting changed in another room,
and we locked the door for privacy.

But someone tried to force it open! We could
hear it rattling against the frame!
Huh?!

Then they left without a word. I was
terrified!
It startled me, too. I was scared speechless.
You don’t say... That sounds real scary...

Yeah, Aoi turned white as a sheet. Are you
feeling okay now? Doing better?

Uh, yeah... It was really scary, but I’m over
it now.

(That was probably me... I remember finding
a locked door I thought was strange.)

It had to have been Minoru. It’s just the
sort of thing he would do.

D-don’t say that. I’d hate to blame him for
it when we don’t have any proof.

But who else could it have been? Can’t you
just see him saying he thought it’d be funny?
That does sound like him...

(Oh no, they’re going to blame Minoru, and he
didn’t do anything wrong! That’s awful!)

(Should I admit it was me? But...then they’d
get mad at me over an accident.)

(Man, Minoru would know just what to do in
this situation. Hm? Now there’s a thought...)
(Anyway, I’ve got to say something!)
Tell the truth.
Blame Minoru.
Try Minoru’s approach.
Tell the truth.
I’m sorry! It was me!
Huh?!
What?! Takuma?!

What were you thinking? I certainly hope you
can explain yourself.

No! It wasn’t like that! I didn’t do it on
purpose!

It’s just, when that door wouldn’t open,
I thought maybe it was another spiderweb!
A spiderweb? Seriously?
Oh...so that’s why you tried to force it.

But once I realized it was just locked,
I figured I might as well move on.
Uh-huh. Sure.
I didn’t mean to scare you. I’m sorry.

No, that’s okay! It sounds like it was an
accident, so don’t worry about it.

Really, I’m sorry. I’ll try to be more
careful next time.

It’s all right! No need to apologize. Thanks
for telling us the truth. I appreciate it.
Phew...
You actually buy that, Aoi?

Then again, Takuma doesn’t seem like the type
who’d do something creepy.
Haha, I’m glad you believe me.
Blame Minoru.

You know, I did see Minoru messing with one
of the doors.
I knew it!
You mean, it really was Minoru?
(Sorry, Minoru!)

Still, knowing him, he probably didn’t mean
anything by it. I’m sure it was just a prank.

Yeah. Minoru’s like a kid who never grew up.
He wouldn’t do it to be creepy.
You think spying on us is some kind of joke?!
No. You’re right... Sorry.

Ugh, this makes me so mad! Next time I see
Minoru, he’s going to pay for this!

Um, Saki? T-try not to go overboard, okay?
Maybe just lecture him?
Anyway, thanks for telling us, Takuma.
No problem...

(Minoru...I’m so sorry. I’ll have to make
this up to you next time I see you.)
Try Minoru’s approach.

(I know, this will all work out if I can just
think up a good line like Minoru would use.)
So, uh, actually...that was me.
Huh?!
What?! Takuma?!

Yeah, I thought it’d be funny to mess with
you a bit, keep you on your toes.

I didn’t realize you’d take it so seriously.
Sorry about that, really.

(Ugh, I can’t believe I just said that. Even
Minoru wouldn’t be this casual about it.)
(How are they taking it?)
Takuma...
Yeah?
*sniff*... *sob*

Takuma, how could you?! *sniff* That was
awful!
(Oh no... I made her cry.)
You... You’d better be ready to pay for this!

I’m really sorry. I’ll accept whatever
punishment you want.

(It’s only fair. After a response like that,
I didn’t have a leg to stand on.)

(I had to constantly apologize to Aoi and let
Saki put me on cleaning duty for a week.)

What do you think, maybe cover one side of
the door with paper?

We should at least make one classroom the
changing room.

(Seems like they’re talking more to each
other than me now.)

(Suddenly, I feel exhausted. Maybe I’d better
go somewhere else.)

(I don’t think I have the guts to join in on
girl talk. I’d better leave.)
